snippet: In a video message apparently made by the leader of the Islamist group, Abubakar Shekau called the schoolgirls slaves and threatened to “sell them in the market, by Allah.”
abstract: Abubakar Shekau, leader of Nigerian Islamist group Boko Haram, claims responsibility in video message for kidnapping of hundreds of schoolgirls, calling them slaves and threatens to sell them; it is first time group has claimed responsibility for the kidnappings, which have ignited a rare antigovernment protest movement and embarrassed Pres Goodluck Jonathan's government.

byline.contributor: Hamza Idris contributed reporting from Maiduguri, Nigeria, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: In a video message apparently made by the leader of the Islamist group, Abubakar Shekau called the schoolgirls slaves and threatened to “sell them in the market, by Allah.”

headline.main: Nigerian Islamist Leader Threatens to Sell Kidnapped Girls
